title: Hinting in Fontographer 4
content: I saw on a post somewhere else on these boards that the auto hinting in Fontographer 4 is flawed. Can anyone tell me more? I don
author: selfbuildtype

comments.content:
See the message of Peter Bruhn on Technical Issues & Techniques / Type design process.   
Ricardo
Thanks. The fontlab link 404s but its fine as a google translation. Cheers...

Here's the link Peter Bruhn provided to David Lemon's article on hinting:   
   
 [http://www.pyrus.com/downloads/hinting.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419175806/http:/www.pyrus.com/downloads/hinting.pdf)  
   
It's also available in html fomat, thanks to Google.com:   
   
 [http://google.com/search?q=cache:ZHA0khd1fmEC:www.pyrus.com/downloads/hinting.pdf+Fontographer+Hinting&hl=en](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419175806/http:/google.com/search?q=cache:ZHA0khd1fmEC:www.pyrus.com/downloads/hinting.pdf%2BFontographer%2BHinting&hl=en)   
   
I have also come across this article, "Hints on Hinting in Fontographer" on Macromedia's site:   
   
 [http://www.macromedia.com/support/fontographer/ts/documents/tn3718.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419175806/http:/www.macromedia.com/support/fontographer/ts/documents/tn3718.html)   
   
And then, there is this rather useful basic tutorial on font design, including manual hinting, from [Divide By Zero]:   
   
 [http://www.andrew.cmu.edu/~twm/makefont/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419175806/http:/www.andrew.cmu.edu/~twm/makefont/)   
   
David

I had that problem with it this morning too, but it worked fine when Peter posted it. Odd. That's how I happened upon the Google translation, actually.   
   
Anyway, I hope these help. I'm trying to figure out hinting as well. ![:)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419175806im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
David
